sub_title: Owner of SmarTrix industrial design and engineering at SmarTrix
summary:
Experienced developer of plastic and metal products for various types of industries.
 
Allmost 20 years of professional experience in mould design and CAM programming.

Possess licenses for Cimatron and Solidworks Premium Simulation Premium and Plastics Professional.

Specialties: Designing products with complex forms with surface or solid modeling. 
Designing plastic products based on my broad experience in mould design and manufacturing techniques. 
Strong at generating practical out-of-the-box solutions with good analytic skills.
Good social and communicative skills with a flexible attitude.

education.field_of_study: designing and building measuring instruments for physics and astronomy

profile_positions.description:
I founded SmarTrix in 2000 and have worked for a wide variety of companies in the Netherlands and Belgium.
Possess licenses for Cimatron and Solidworks Premium and Simulation Premium. 
Experienced developer of plastic and metal products for various types of industries. More than 20 years of professional experience in mould design and CAM programming.

Market experience

Automotive industry
Aerospace industry
Mechanical and electronics industry
Sign and Display industry
Packaging industry
Orchid industry
Music industry

General experience

•	Designing and building moulds for various industries.
•	Designing numerous complex products for a variety of clients in the plastic and metal industry.
•	Programming milling machines with 3D CAD/CAM for a large number of clients in the mould, instruments and aerospace industries.
•	Building and testing prototypes of the designs I made.
•	Consulting companies that are not experienced in developing their own products.
•	Designing aluminum extrusion profiles.
•	Advising Johnson Controls on optimizing plastic automotive parts for aluminum moulds.

Project experience

A company in the domotics (home automation) industry developed a new line of RF components. These components had to be built in plastic housings. The company did not have the expertise themselves so they hired Remco Rietveld to design the housings, test the prototypes, supervise the mould-making process and check the final products. Due to there being limited organizational layers, this process was completed in a relatively short time.

For a company in the orchid industry, Remco Rietveld developed a new line of products that makes it possible to grow more orchids per square meter and improves the overall efficiency.
This was accomplished by (among other things) analyzing the growth of the orchid in several stages.
